project.name: documentation
project.description: The Gentoo Documentation Project is the official Gentoo project devoted to the complete and concise documentation of the Gentoo Project.

p.b: What we do, and who we are

longdescription.p: The Gentoo Documentation Project (GDP) is the official project of the Gentoo project responsible for the creation and maintenance of all official Gentoo documentation. The GDP is not a closed team of any sorts, but instead an open community committed to critiquing, and possibly integrating, viable user documentation.

The Gentoo Documentation Project was formed to address the need of complete documentation for Gentoo. In doing so, the GDP team is committed to the creation and maintenance of clear, concise, and original documentation. We will protect our users and developers by the use of free and open licensing on all documentation. The GDP is committed to remaining a free and open project, and will abide by the Social Contract set forth by the Gentoo Project.

task.name: Coding Style
task.description: Applying a Coding Style to be used for all Documentation
task.longdescription: As documentation is a joint effort of several editors and authors, it is necessary to use a common coding style so that updates, changes and new documentation don't differ too much internally. This way, editors can easily make patches to documentation without being harassed too much with a different coding, having to change their editor-tool or even have to manually type in stuff they want to automate themselves. It is also important to have a uniform external coding style so that users are not confused about how documentation is written (consistent writing).

milestone.description: Write and Approve draft style. Publish online.
Convert all existing documentation to the coding style.

task.name: Offproject Documentation
task.longdescription: Several projects have their own documentation which they place inside their CVS directory because it is easier for them. However, this documentation is frequently interesting for users and/or developers. This task aims to have an official policy on this documentation, how it is handled, where it is linked etc.

milestone.description: Get the opinion on all related managers regarding the documentation and how it should be handled.
Have all managers agree on a certain "policy" for this documentation. This policy can be a one-liner :)

task.name: GuideXML2PDF
task.description: Provide PDF files of all (or most) of the Gentoo documentation
task.longdescription: The call for PDF'ed versions of our documentation is increasing. However, providing PDFs generated offsite is very difficult and may lead to old versions. In the spirit of "what is online is up to date" we are searching for ways to convert the GuideXML to PDF on-the-fly. Possibilities are XSL:FO, but others (using scripts etc.) are possible too.

milestone.description: Explore all possibilities and report those to gentoo-doc

body.p: The Gentoo Documentation Project makes intensive use of the gentoo-doc@gentoo.org mailing list. On this mailing list discussions about documentation, subprojects, translations and more pass by.

To subscribe to this mailing list, send an empty e-mail to gentoo-doc-subscribe@gentoo.org. Once subscribed you can post to it by sending an e-mail to gentoo-doc@gentoo.org. To unsubscribe from the list, send an empty e-mail to gentoo-doc-unsubscribe@gentoo.org. There is also an online archive on news.gmane.org.

To participate in the Gentoo Documentation Project first join the mailing list at gentoo-doc@gentoo.org. Then ask if there are plans to support something that you are interested in, propose a new subproject that you are interested in, or choose one of the planned subprojects to work on. You may talk to the developers and users in the IRC channel #gentoo-doc on irc.freenode.net for more information or just to chat about the project or any subprojects. If you don't have the ability to actively help by contributing work we will always need editors to maintain the quality and accuracy of the overall product. All development, editing, and productive comments and feedback will be greatly appreciated.
